text.div:
Release Date: 2018-08-12

LevelCodeDisplayDefinition
1PWAF Paid work, Armed Forces A situation in which an individual serves in a government-sponsored military force.
1PWFG Paid work, national government, not armed forces A situation in which an individual works for a national government organization, not including armed forces, and receives a paid salary or wage.
1PWLG Paid work, local government, not armed forces A situation in which an individual works for a government organization with jurisdiction below the level of state/provincial/territorial/tribal government (e.g., city, town, township), not armed forces, and receives a paid salary or wage.
1PWNSE Paid non-governmental work, not self-employed A situation in which an individual works for a business (not government) that they do not own and receives a paid salary or wage.
1PWSE Paid work, self-employed A situation in which an individual earns a salary or wage working for himself or herself instead of working for an employer.
1PWSG Paid work, state government, not armed forces A situation in which an individual works for a government organization with jurisdiction immediately below the level of national government (between national government and local government), not armed forces and receives a paid salary or wage. Often called a state, provincial, territorial, or tribal government.
1UWNSE Unpaid non-governmental work, not self-employed A situation in which an individual works for a business (not government) that they do not own without receiving a paid salary or wage.
1UWSE Unpaid work, self-employed A situation in which an individual works for himself or herself without receiving a paid salary or wage.
1VW Voluntary work A situation in which an individual chooses to do something, especially for other people or for an organization, willingly and without being forced or compensated to do it. This can include formal activity undertaken through public, private and voluntary organizations as well as informal community participation.

name: v3.WorkClassificationODH
title: v3 Code System WorkClassificationODH
description: Code system of concepts representing a person's job type as defined by compensation and sector (e.g. paid vs. unpaid, self-employed vs. not self-employed, government vs. private, etc.).
